intro: Hieracium candidum subsp. erosulum, commonly known as the white hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies. It has a rosette of basal leaves and produces a single stem with several flower heads. The subspecies erosulum is distinguished by its white or pale yellow flowers and slightly different leaf morphology compared to other Hieracium species.
